pages.text: Frondophyllas grandis comes from the late Ediacaran, with fossils found from Newfoundland, Canada. It is a tree-like petalonamid lifeform, and could grow up to over 1 m in height. Although it is noted that these heights are from incomplete fossil material, meaning Fronodphyllas most likely grown much taller, maybe even surpassing forms like Trepassia.

The generic name derives from the Latin word 'frondis', to mean 'leafy branch'; and the Greek word 'phyllon', to mean 'leaf'. Its specific name derives from the Latin Word 'grandis', to mean 'great/grand'.
